forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.shortForecast: Patchy Fog then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog between 8am and 9am, then a chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 8 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

weather_report:
As dawn approaches in Downtown San Francisco, the city is cloaked in a veil of patchy fog, lending an ethereal quality to the waking world. The air is crisp and cool, lingering around fifty degrees with a gentle west southwest breeze whispering through the streets. As you step outside, a light layer of moisture clings to the atmosphere, and the softness of the fog mingles with the promise of a partly sunny day ahead. As the morning unfolds, expect a delicate transformation, with a potential sprinkle of rain surfacing in the late hours. 

The weather is balanced—refreshing yet slightly oppressive in its humidity. Layers will be your best companion; a light jacket over a sweater would protect against the chill while remaining comfortable as the temperature nudges slightly upward, peaking near fifty-eight. Perhaps consider a stroll through the less frequented corners of the city, where the fog plays hide-and-seek with landmarks and flavor spills from cozy coffee shops. Venture into a boutique or lose yourself in a bookstore, finding solace in the pages until the sun breaks through and illuminates the streets once more.
